result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Coyie S. Fox

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

At the request of the PSI writer, Agent Nolan, SEH on 10/26/22 is rescheduled to 12/2/22 at 11:00 am; so she may interview the DE for the PSI report. No objection by either party. Parties notified by email. New order for PSI sent.

ADDRESS INFO for Coyie S. Fox
Current: Shalom Center 4314 39th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 3721 - 15th Street  #2B, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States

11:06 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Coyie S. Fox in court.  Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri in court for Coyie S. Fox. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF255/22CF303. Attorney Balistrieri is requesting an adjournment so the DE may have an input on the PSI report; DE did not have a cell phone to contact the PSI writer and by the time he did obtain a cell phone to set up a meeting the PSI writer said it was too late. State takes no position. Court will adjourn the sentencing hearing for reasons set forth on the record. DE updates contact information on the record.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:52 PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Coyie S. Fox, appeared in custody with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF255/22CF303.   Victim rights compliance. Matters are resolved. Attorney Balistrieri requests that the Court hear his motion to modify bond on Case 22CF303 as the DE was accepted in to the vivitrol program. Court will hear bond motion after the Court takes the DE's plea.
22CF255:  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 2-3 are dismissed and read in. 
22CF303:  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1 & 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 3-5 are dismissed and read in.   

Presentence Investigation ordered. Bond motion filed in Case 22CF303 by Attorney Balistrieri filed on 8/11/22. Arguments heard. State does not object to a signature bond. For reasons set forth on the record the Court will modify the defendant's bond to a $20,000 signature bond with conditions: No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Jennifer M, Kendrick R..  Must participate and comply w/ all vivitrol program requirements. *Any violation of the vivitrol program or bond the DE will immediately be taken in to custody and it shall be reported to the Court within 48 hours of the violation; DE shall be returned to Branch 6.* 
**This signature bond is contingent upon the DE having a set residence/address of the half-way house at the time of release, so if a bed is not available the DE will not be released**  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NAJ returned.
  Return to sender.  Temporarily Away.  Return to sender.

09:02 AM Defendant Coyie S. Fox appeared by phone means and in-custody.  Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri in court for Defendant Coyie S. Fox.
Prosecuting Atty Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
22CF255 & 22CF303:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Def. trying to get into the Vivatrol Program.
Bond motion heard on case 22CF303; Motion was denied.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Coyie S. Fox appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Defendant in custody. Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
